intro: Machaerium stipitatum, commonly known as the slender machaerium, is a tropical plant native to regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its flowers are usually pale or whitish, and it produces small, flat pods that contain several seeds. Machaerium stipitatum is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested or disturbed areas.
